locations.name: Main Deck
locations.brief_description: You are on the main deck of a large cargo ship. The deck is eerily quiet. Ropes and cargo containers are scattered around. You can go below deck to the South, to the bridge North, or to the port side West.
locations.long_description: You wake up on the main deck of a large cargo ship with no memory of how you got here. The sun is setting, casting long shadows across the weathered wooden planks. The ship rocks gently on the waves. There's an unsettling silence—no crew members anywhere. You notice claw marks gouged into the metal railings. Dark stains stain the deck near the cargo containers. You can go below deck to the South, climb to the bridge North, or explore the port side West.

locations.name: Cargo Hold
locations.brief_description: You are in the dark cargo hold below deck. Large metal containers are stacked high. You can return to the main deck North, or explore deeper into the hold East.
locations.long_description: You descend into the cargo hold. It's dimly lit by a few flickering emergency lights. The air is thick and humid. Massive metal shipping containers are stacked precariously. Several containers have been torn open, their contents scattered across the floor. You see more massive claw marks on the container walls—whatever caused them was enormous. You can return to the main deck North or explore deeper East.

locations.name: Bridge
locations.brief_description: You are on the ship's bridge. Navigation equipment and controls are everywhere. The captain's chair sits empty. You can descend back to the main deck South or enter the Captain's Cabin to the East.
locations.long_description: You climb to the bridge of the ship. Navigation screens flicker with warnings. Charts are scattered across the control panels. The captain's leather chair sits abandoned. Through the window, you can see the ocean stretching endlessly. The radio is emitting static. You notice deep gouges in the metal walls here too. To the East is the Captain's Cabin—your way to send a distress signal. You can descend back to the main deck South.

locations.name: Port Side
locations.brief_description: You are on the port side of the ship. The railings are damaged. You can see something glinting in the water below. You can return to the main deck East or climb up to the crow's nest North.
locations.long_description: You walk along the port side of the ship. The railings are twisted and broken in several places. Looking down, you can see the dark water below and something large moving beneath the surface. There are deep gouges in the hull as if something massive clawed at the ship. You can return to the main deck East or climb up to the crow's nest North using the ladder.

locations.name: Deep Hold
locations.brief_description: You are deep in the cargo hold. It's very dark. You can hear water dripping. You can return West to the main cargo hold.
locations.long_description: You venture deeper into the cargo hold. It's pitch black except for your ability to see. Water drips from above. The air smells of salt and something rotten. You see a massive hole in the hull—the ship is taking on water slowly. This must have been where the creature broke through. You can return West to the main cargo hold. A terrible feeling washes over you as you hear a distant, otherworldly sound echoing through the hold.

locations.name: Captain's Cabin
locations.brief_description: You are in the Captain's Cabin. A large desk dominates the room. Navigation charts cover the walls. You can return to the Bridge West.
locations.long_description: You enter the Captain's Cabin. It's well-furnished with nautical decorations. The captain's desk is covered with charts and a ship's log. A radio system sits on a side table—this is how you can call for help. You notice a recent entry in the log describing strange sonar readings. On the desk is a mysterious key. The walls here are also scarred with claw marks, but less severe than elsewhere. You can return to the Bridge West.

locations.name: Crow's Nest
locations.brief_description: You are high up in the crow's nest. You can see the entire ocean around you. You can climb back down South.
locations.long_description: You climb high into the crow's nest at the top of the ship's mast. From here, you can see for miles across the ocean in all directions. The view is magnificent but terrifying—you're completely exposed. In the distance, you see something massive moving through the water, creating waves as it travels. Its silhouette is enormous and vaguely serpentine. You realize what attacked the ship. The creature seems to be circling. You can climb back down South, but you feel watched from the water below.

locations.name: Rigging Section
locations.brief_description: You are in the ship's rigging. Ropes and pulleys surround you. You can go down to the Port Side South or continue to the emergency raft West.
locations.long_description: You descend from the crow's nest into the rigging section. The ropes creak and sway in the wind. Suddenly, you feel the entire ship shudder violently. A massive shape rises from the water on the port side—the sea monster! Its tentacle-like appendages reach toward the ship. You must act quickly. You can try to reach the emergency raft West or descend to the Port Side South.

locations.name: Emergency Raft
locations.brief_description: You are at the emergency raft. It's partially lowered. You can attempt to escape West or return to the ship East.
locations.long_description: You reach the emergency raft attached to the side of the ship. It's small but functional. The raft is partially lowered, ready to deploy. The water below churns as the sea monster thrashes nearby. You have mere seconds. You can attempt to lower the raft and escape West into the ocean, or return to the ship East to try another route.

locations.name: Open Ocean - Safe Escape
locations.brief_description: You are drifting safely in the emergency raft, away from the monster. Help is on the way.
locations.long_description: You successfully lower the raft and drift away from the doomed ship. The emergency beacon is transmitting your location. In the distance, you see the sea monster circling the ship, but it's no longer interested in your small raft. A rescue ship appears on the horizon. You're safe. As you wait for rescue, you reflect on the impossible creature you encountered. The truth about what attacked the ship will be a mystery for marine biologists to solve.

locations.name: Captain's Cabin - Signal Sent
locations.brief_description: You sent a distress signal! A rescue ship is on the way. You are safe in the Captain's Cabin.
locations.long_description: You successfully send a distress signal from the Captain's Cabin. The radio crackles to life as the nearest coast guard station acknowledges your message. They confirm a rescue ship is en route and will reach you in approximately 4 hours. You are safe. As you wait, you document everything you've learned about the attack. The captain's log entries, the physical evidence, and your observations will help scientists understand this unprecedented encounter with a sea monster.

locations.name: Monster Attack - Game Over
locations.brief_description: The creature catches you. Game Over.
locations.long_description: You didn't escape in time. The sea monster's massive tentacle wraps around you. This is the end. At least now, the mystery of the ship's fate is solved. Your body is never recovered, but the ship's wreckage eventually washes ashore, providing evidence of the creature's existence.

items.name: captain_log
items.description: The ship's captain's log. Recent entries mention strange sonar readings and unusual animal activity.

items.name: crew_manifest
items.description: A manifest listing all crew members. All 47 crew members are accounted for... but where are they?

items.name: radio_key
items.description: A small brass key for activating the bridge's emergency radio system.

items.name: torn_flag
items.description: The ship's flag, torn and tattered with what looks like claw marks through it.

items.name: water_sample
items.description: A vial of murky water from the cargo hold. It has an unusual phosphorescent glow.

items.name: safe_key
items.description: An ornate key found on the Captain's desk. It likely opens the captain's safe.

items.name: spyglass
items.description: A brass telescope used for spotting objects at sea. Through it, you saw the sea monster.

items.name: rope
items.description: A length of sturdy nautical rope. Could be useful for securing things or climbing.

items.name: flare_gun
items.description: An emergency flare gun with three flares remaining. Could signal for help.
